Let's suppose you could learn a domain or a skill instantly, but only one. What would you choose ?

I would like to learn instantly 3D animation skills.

Learning the ability to learn languages by reading the mind of native speakers.

Realistically speaking: Anything that will get me paid well for very few working hours.
Magnets
How to get away with anything ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I would learn to turn invisible.

I would learn everything to do with physics and math.

The meaning of life, how to time travel, how to go faster then light, how to take off from Eve in 1.0, how to get away with murder, how to save the world, if the big bang or God created the universe (my bets on The Big Bang), why I sit inside all day, why people are assholes, how to fly a rocket, how to apply as an astronaut. I have a lot of things I want to know.
The ability to speak every language. Russian and Greek are so beautiful sounding and looking when written.
The ability to speak german, this way I could understand the real scienz roket \*ach\*
Rocket Science. That's what I want to be.
Woodworking?
In terms of vaguely realistic things and not "meta skill that lets you learn all everything," a natural language. Probably Russian or Japanese.
I would learn how to make a KSP parts mod on Mac without procrastinating.
I'd learn how to learn everything!

Thank you for all your input !

If there was another thing I would like to learn, it would be Russian. Such an interesting language.

To learn about how to learn.

More specifically, how to remember better and read faster.

Really, I can't remember stuff well and reading things takes forever. If I'm having a particularly hard time concentrating, I have to read things like 3 to 5 times!
Computer Programming.
Coding.
either rocket science or astrophysics. I want to be an astronaut
The secrets of unrealistic propellantless engines, that work well in our universe
Being able to speak English with any accent. 4 teh lulz.

Fantastic: DnD wizard spells and skills on epic level. (Level 28, like my character in DDO). That's include epic flight, with at least 2 hours endurance.

Realistic: Natural Physics, including supporting math, on **modern level**, not that 100 years old stuff I got in university, and almost eternally forgot by now. Including perfect understanding of ballistics, fluid dynamics and strength of materials. And a little bonus : 256 IQ and perfect memory.

Ahm ... and I want back my asm knowledge for Z80 and 386.
Playing the piano.

Sometime ... just the ability to "really entirely" forgive a few things i have learned before.
